critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving an agreement within the construction industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. This act was a key part of the New Deal, aimed at economic recovery during the Great Depression. The agreement pertains to fair competition and labor relations within the Plumbing Contracting Division in Denver, Colorado. Given the context, several axes can be evaluated. Ideologically, the document reflects a liberal approach due to government intervention in the economy. Economically, it leans towards intervention as it involves government approval of agreements between employers and employees. Federalism is strengthened as the federal government is overseeing and approving local agreements. Social inclusion is likely neutral as the document doesn't explicitly address diversity or conformity. Executive power is somewhat expanded as the President is directly approving the agreement. National security vs. civil liberties is not directly addressed in this document, so it should be neutral. Immigration is not addressed.
